content:
Chicken tikka masala is a fantastic choice! Congratulations on mastering it in a cooking class. Indian cuisine offers a wide range of delicious options to pair with your dish. Here are some suggestions to complement your chicken tikka masala:

**Starters:**

1. Papri Chaat: A popular Indian street food, papri chaat is a flavorful and refreshing mix of boiled potatoes, chickpeas, onions, and yogurt, topped with crispy fried bread and spices.
2. Vegetable Samosas: Crunchy samosas filled with spiced potatoes, peas, and onions will make a great accompaniment to your meal.
3. Raita: A cool and creamy yogurt-based side dish with cucumber, cumin, and coriander will help balance the spiciness of the main course.

**Sides:**

1. Basmati Rice: Aromatic basmati rice is a classic pairing for chicken tikka masala. You can also flavor it with saffron, cardamom, or cinnamon for added depth.
2. Naan Bread: Serve warm, fluffy naan bread to mop up the rich and creamy sauce of the chicken tikka masala. You can also offer garlic naan or butter naan for variety.
3. Roasted Vegetables: Roasted vegetables like cauliflower, carrots, and bell peppers with a hint of cumin and coriander will provide a nice contrast to the rich main dish.
4. Saag Aloo: A spicy mustard green curry with potatoes (saag aloo) will add a nice depth to the meal.

**Desserts:**

1. Gulab Jamun: These sweet, syrupy dumplings are a classic Indian dessert. You can make them from scratch or use store-bought ones.
2. Cardamom Rice Pudding (Kheer): A creamy and comforting dessert flavored with cardamom, saffron, and nuts will round off the meal nicely.
3. Kulfi: Indian-style ice cream flavored with cardamom, saffron, or rosewater will provide a refreshing finish to the meal.

**Beverages:**

1. Mango Lassi: A yogurt-based drink blended with mango puree and spices will help cool down the palate.
2. Chai: Serve a soothing cup of spiced tea, like masala chai or ginger tea, to conclude the meal.
3. Cucumber Lime Refresher: A light and refreshing drink made with cucumber, lime juice, and mint will help cut the richness of the meal.

Feel free to pick and choose from these suggestions to create a well-rounded and delicious Indian-inspired menu for your dinner party!
